Key Arguments: The terms 'misinformation' and 'disinformation' have been imported from the US and have caused division.
Public trust in government and media is at an all-time low due to perceived authoritarian actions.
The legislation could be used to shut down public debate and dissenting opinions.
Governments and social media companies might use the legislation for self-promotion and censorship.
All information should be available for Australians to assess, without censorship.
The legislation is compared to censorship practices in authoritarian regimes.
Notable Quotes: Censorship of this type has absolutely no place in a democratic system such as ours.
It is offensive to assume that this population cannot be trusted to make decisions relating to internet content for themselves.
